level.text: Whenever a diver dives in polluted waters using a suit and helmet (deep sea or hard hat equipment), the following precautions shall be taken:
Avoid taking in water through the spit cock or by other means;
Hose the diver off when he or she surfaces to remove any clinging filth;
Avoid putting hands in mouth after tending or working with diving equipment;
Avoid handling food after tending or working with diving equipment; and
Wash hands thoroughly and bathe as soon as possible when the job is completed.
Whenever a diver dives in polluted waters using scuba equipment, the following precautions shall be taken:
Use equipment with a full-face mask;
Wear a full, dry type rubber swim suit;
Hose the diver off when he or she surfaces to remove any clinging filth;
Avoid putting hands in mouth after tending or working with diving equipment;
Avoid handling food after tending or working with diving equipment; and
Wash hands thoroughly and bathe as soon as possible when the job is completed.
Whenever a diver is injured while diving in polluted water, the diver shall do the following:
Surface promptly;
Cleanse the wound thoroughly with soap and water; and
Obtain a tetanus booster.
In all diving operations conducted in polluted waters, every diver’s inoculations shall be up to date.
In all diving operations conducted in polluted waters, an illness of any diver shall be reported promptly.
